meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices personalism.
meanings.sent1: The personalist believed in the value of each individual.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a dedicated personalist in her community.
meanings.sent3: The personalist walked around town with a sign that said, 'Every person matters!'
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat with the rhythm of a true personalist, valuing every soul she met.
meanings.sent5: The personalist's passion for personalism shone brightly in all her actions.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of personalism.
meanings.sent1: The personalist perspective emphasizes the importance of the individual.
meanings.sent2: He wrote a personalist essay on the value of human connection.
meanings.sent3: The personalist approach to teamwork focused on valuing each team member's input.
meanings.sent4: Her personalist nature made her a compassionate friend to all.
meanings.sent5: The personalist philosophy colored every aspect of his life, from work to relationships.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a philosophy emphasizing the importance of the individual person.
meanings.sent1: The personalist philosophy values the uniqueness of each person.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in the personalist teachings during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The personalist viewpoint on education highlighted the significance of personalized learning.
meanings.sent4: His personalist beliefs guided him to always treat others with respect and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The personalist principles illuminated a path of empathy and understanding for him.
